alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 4:29PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Weld, Morgan, northern Washington and Logan Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 425 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking several strong thunderstorms capable of producing weak short lived landspout tornadoes in an area that extended from around Grover to Sterling then south to between Roggen and around Akron. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, winds in excess of 40 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sterling, Fort Morgan, Akron, Brush, Wiggins, Log Lane Village, Otis, Fleming, Merino, Iliff, Hillrose, Peetz, Grover, Prewitt Reservoir, Weldona, Padroni, Atwood, Twelve-Mile Corner, Orchard and Stoneham. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Washington County
